Package chess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class is the heart of the game and contains all the necessary logic for gameplay
    Author:
    Sreekar Vedula, Quan Li

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Initializes the game board by creating an 8x8 array to hold all the pieces and setting them to their respective locations

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean isCheck​(boolean white)
      Checks whether the king of the specified team is in check
      boolean isCheckMate​(boolean white)
      Checks if the specified king has been checkmated, leading to the end of the game
      boolean movePiece​(java.lang.String[] input, boolean turn)
      Moves a piece on the chess board by updating its array if it is valid.
      void printBoard()
      Prints out the chess board by traversing a 2D array

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Initializes the game board by creating an 8x8 array to hold all the pieces and setting them to their respective locations

    • Method Detail

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints out the chess board by traversing a 2D array

      • movePiece

        public boolean movePiece​(java.lang.String[] input,
                         boolean turn)
        Moves a piece on the chess board by updating its array if it is valid.
        Parameters:
        input - An array of strings that contains the starting and ending points for each move.
        turn - Indicates the color of the team that is currently making a move. True stands for white and False stands for black.
        Returns:
        Returns True if the move is valid and was successfully made. False indicates an illegal move and prompts the user to try again.

      • isCheck

        public boolean isCheck​(boolean white)
        Checks whether the king of the specified team is in check
        Parameters:
        white - The color of the king, where true stands for white and false stands for black
        Returns:
        True if the king is in check and false otherwise

      • isCheckMate

        public boolean isCheckMate​(boolean white)
        Checks if the specified king has been checkmated, leading to the end of the game
        Parameters:
        white - The color of the king, where true stands for white and false stands for black
        Returns:
        True if the king has been checkmated
